channel.title: About RS Fishing?
channel.description: Can someone confirm that fishing spots give fish less frequently, and move more, the more people are fishing on that certain spot, just how woodcutting is effected by how many people are cutting the same tree?

item.title: About RS Fishing?
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Thank you both. I’ll leave it at that unless someone else knows any different.

Read full topic

item.title: About RS Fishing?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“The Outsider, post:3, topic:425298”]Thanks, but I already knew that.I would still like to know if fishing is effected by how many people are on one spot? I am wondering this because I am thinking if over time it’s worth fishing in a remote spot.

Jagex obviously put these spots there for a reason, as everything is carefully planned out, and for a reason.[/quote]

Oh. Well no, as unlike wc, there can be an infinite number of fish obtained from one spot, and movement is just based off of timers.

Read full topic

item.title: About RS Fishing?
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

I’ve gotten more fish by fishing by myself, so I’d say yes.

Read full topic

Thanks, but I already knew that.I would still like to know if fishing is effected by how many people are on one spot? I am wondering this because I am thinking if over time it’s worth fishing in a remote spot.

Jagex obviously put these spots there for a reason, as everything is carefully planned out, and for a reason.

item.title: About RS Fishing?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Worlds with a higher population give a faster output rate of fish to provide for the increased amount of people.

Read full topic
